TopicTitle: [Showcase] ARMOURED VEHICLES! Post your pictures here!

Articles.Content:
So ive noticed a large amount of armoured vehicles being created and many of them are scattered around the spacecraft exchange so i thought why not make a place where people can show off their creations and link them to the thread and also have a place where we can share ideas and tips. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

So heres my input so far, my Tank pack from summer 2014:

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/JkIJs)

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/4zkFIJAl2X4?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

[Download Here](http://www./download/txsq3sjcvovc8iy/6000+View+Pack.rar)

Post Post Post, I want to see all these amazing vehicles

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-10T13:12:07Z" title="07/10/2015 01:12  PM" data-short="9 yr">July 10, 2015</time> by Vagani**

Yop !

Good idea to make this thread ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) We have enough Tanks builder now to grow this one very fast !

+ That let the spacecraft exchange cleaner !

So i put two tanks in two versions ( this is not a replica !!) A heavy probe tank electric powered & a Light probe tank Diesel powered ( this one is FUN ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) )

Both incoming in [stock] & [bD-Armory] & are designed to be extremely easy to use with a smooth turret ( Generally 15% / 20% Trim power is enough to make them rotate )

I suggest to use SAS on the Core tank ( Wheels ) & No-SAS on the turret : Key bind is :

Ã¢â‚¬â€¹

0 - Decouple/Undock (both)

1 - Start Fuel Cell Array (Diesel)

2 - Stop Fuel Cell Array (Diesel)

Spc - Next Weapon (BD-Only)

R - Fire (BD-Only)

G - Drop CM (BD-Only)

Abord - Switch Arm/Guard/Autopilot (BD-Only)

OFC Rebind if you don't like this ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Is kerbpaint compatable with stock installs?

> 
> Is kerbpaint compatable with stock installs?

Yep , Kerpaint only works with [stock] parts , Like a extension !

Find the last patch for full color parts !

yes mods are definitely allowed:) nice apc? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
Yes, itÃ‚Â´s an APC. But the best thing is the smoke system, utilizing 2 LV-909s Terriers makes lots of dust!

> 
> Yes, itÃ‚Â´s an APC. But the best thing is the smoke system, utilizing 2 LV-909s Terriers makes lots of dust!

Thats actually a real neat feature

I usually donÃ‚Â´t like military replicas in KSP but the interleaved "Laufrollen" arrangement like used on the Panzerkampfwagen VI - Tiger I in the OP video is awesome... I bet, it performs very smooth on rough terrain. I have to try that for a base construction vehicle...

> 
> I usually donÃ‚Â´t like military replicas in KSP but the interleaved "Laufrollen" arrangement like used on the Panzerkampfwagen VI - Tiger I in the OP video is awesome... I bet, it performs very smooth on rough terrain. I have to try that for a base construction vehicle...

Yeah, we've been using them for military vehicles for a long time. They work well, but don't take battle damage nearly as well as my porsche suspension.

I made this small Troop Carrier today i am quite happy how it turned out. This vechicle also features "slat armor" on the sides and on the front. 

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/zofgm)

This is my first tank chassis. I'm still busy with the auto-loader and sometimes even redesigning the shells so in the mean time I've released the chassis as an IFV.

It's not pretty, but it has multi-layered armor all around, including protection against landmines.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/ZWNhz)

Suggested mods: 

Take Command (puts kerbals in seats)

Rover Autopilot

Features:

Armor plating all around.

Fuel cell with fuel tank, range is huge.

Top speed 82km/h.

Independent suspension, able to climb over and drive through very rough terrain (limited speed).

14 driven wheels, 4 stabilization wheels.

Able to drive with 6 of it's 7 wheels broken on one side, at almost top speed!

8 spin-stabilized unguided missiles.

Room for 8 kerbals.

Very sturdy! 

Mass: 40.1t. 

Dimensions: 6.52 x 4.39 x 10.9

Download Link: 

[http://kerbalx.com/crafts/3855](http://kerbalx.com/crafts/3855)

Whoo. Damn amazing visual models ya'll are building. All I have to show is a home-brew fast medium that's, and I think for the first time in this thread, actually on tracks.

![cX63pmn.png](http://i.imgur.com/cX63pmn.png)

90mm gun, 40 rounds in the ammo rack, able to take a couple hits frontally and from the side from that same 90 mil. Totally unmanned, uses a MJ AR202 case as a probe core and a couple fuel cells with an oscar B hidden under the rear armor for electrical generation. It can even go to space!

![Rxr2DWx.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/Rxr2DWx.jpg)

I have built versions armed with 120mm and 152mm cannons, but the 90mm gun here seems to be the best fit to the chassis.

Edit: Built a casemate assault gun on the hull. I honestly think this looks more like a real-world vehicle, something the Soviets would have fielded in WW2, so I named it as such. 105 translates to the bore of the main gun.

![HAaZzQu.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/HAaZzQu.jpg)

I doubled up the armor on the casemate for this one. Each side panel, sloped frontal panel, angled rear panel(not pictured) is doubled up. Sloped, spaced armor fills up the lower two thirds of the casemate sides to help with the slab sidedness, below that there's three layers of armor(Skirt, Track, iron I-beam) before a shot could get into the fighting compartment. This thing's a pretty tough nut to crack, that medium I posted above can't reliably destroy it except from behind.
